author: UCkvJAgpo05D7VukL_en4Oow
comment: @soph s I do like my job but their lots of cons. guess I‚Äôll be brutally honest. There is a reason this job has such a low amount of people and has such a high burnout rate. It‚Äôs grueling on the body, the hours suck, lack of sleep is common, the money isn‚Äôt amazing unless you plan on owning, stress is daily, and you see things that may stick with you for the rest of your life. This job is practically a life style. I would highly suggest at least trying out an apprenticeship for a year before commuting to going to school because then you won‚Äôt end up losing money if you don‚Äôt end up liking the profession.

author: UCsvEGvY6d0Fr0SMIH1gtVLw
comment: It really annoys me when these horror games try to have both a silent and vocal protagonist. From the moment you start the game, Rebecca is a vocal protagonist who speaks, and reacts. Then when the scares start happening, she's completely silent. When the body disappeared from the gurney, that wasn't a figment of the imagination or an illusion that the two scares before it could have been. The body is *physically* gone and you have to go find it, and Rebecca says *nothing*.

author: UCHGynwWS4jfiWWSdt9vmiTg
comment: Thats completely fair! But If it makes it better, im pretty sure it was implied that she is schizophrenic, which was what the hallucinations and the sanitary room you see where she hangs herself shows: Rebecca in a mental facility. So, maybe she just knows that there isn't any point in commenting on those things? Because it's all in her head. Though I do agree they could have at least added a "Oh, not this again." line or something.

author: UCPiWh9SawbZ31thFs3WfaCg
comment: You inspired me to get one of the sigils Mark and I finally was able to get it.  I followed your lead with the ashes and was able to place them on the pentagram and then expanded on your attempt to use the matches by lighting the ashes and bingo! 1 sigil which I put in the bottom of the clay puzzle (I saw a playthrough that had that spot filled on the clay disk in the dream sequence).  As I'm sure you guessed, this ultimately changed the ending dialogue, although only slightly; however, it does give a little peek in to the gameplay of the full version.  You were literally the only person I saw that even explored getting the sigils so thank you for the inspiration!

author: UCVeYKyhbDwnZTgL8w9suffQ
comment: This game is always interesting because all the events are time-based rather than triggered by the player. You always see more the longer you play. It‚Äôs very fun to watch.

author: UCVeYKyhbDwnZTgL8w9suffQ
comment: @Ed Vincent Ramillano you would be right about that much. However, you‚Äôre really grasping at straws here mate. I said that it‚Äôs mostly time based when you get to the actual gameplay. That being said, even some of the major events actually trigger after a certain amount of time since each time you inspect the corpse her name and abrasions are actually different‚Ä¶‚Ä¶.per run, that is.

author: UCVeYKyhbDwnZTgL8w9suffQ
comment: @Ed Vincent Ramillano yes, the player will still trigger events. However, there are many more events to trigger the longer you play the game. Even just standing still in the game, events Will eventually end up triggered. Check out CoryxKenshin‚Äôs video if you wanna see what I mean.

author: UCbwi9qMJZPStw7ilqWXTYMA
comment: I remember when Mark played the demo for this. Thoroughly freaked him out despite it's short length. When getting to the end of the demo, it glitched out, & he thought he was potentially missing something big, important or scary. So he replays THE ENTIRE DEMO, only to find that, the only difference between both ending experiences was being jump scared by a ghost or floating cadaver on the second go around.   Got to love his thoroughness & commitment to seeing everything a title has to offer all whilst entertaining us. Thank you Mark!
